page.title: 04WEST ROTTEARNS FARM.
page.content: West Rottearns has 200acres of land but 100acres are about half a mile away across the A9 at Williamfield. The rest is at the main farm.They have 150sheep,300lambs and 100 beef cattle. There are 12 acres of grazing for the cattle in summer.In winter they are kept in 3 large cow-sheds. There is a giant hayshed which holds 1000 bales for winter feeding.In one field half was turnips & half barley, then next year the crops will be changed around. .The sheep are dipped twice a year in a tank which holds 1200litres.The original farm was built 300yrs ago but the present farmhouse is only 23yrs old.They have a working collie & a cross labrador. On a pond 500m from the house swans nestin the reeds & the water that runs from it used to drive the wheel in the old flour mill.
